evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Overcommitment to clubs affecting studies, 2) Guilt around taking breaks, 3) Lack of effective time management. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Prioritizing clubs based on career goals and interests, dropping one and reducing involvement in another, 2) Implementing structured breaks using the Pomodoro method, 3) Creating a realistic schedule with built-in breaks. Student's response to solutions: Positive, willing to try the new schedule and report back. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student feels less overwhelmed, has a clear plan, and is committed to making changes.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Overcommitment to three clubs hurting academic performance, 2) Guilt around taking breaks leading to poor time management. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Evaluating club commitments based on career alignment and interest (keeping art history, reducing others), 2) Implementing structured Pomodoro breaks with timers. Student's response: Immediate acceptance of solutions, recognizing logic behind quality-over-quantity involvement, enthusiasm for trying scheduled breaks. Evidence of progress: Concrete plan to drop one club and reduce another, structured break system adopted, expressed reduced overwhelm and scheduled follow-up to refine approach.
